sub_title: Senior Geoscientist, Geothermal at Veegeo Sproule Geothermal
summary: Driven and resourceful structural geologist with  expert understanding of low-mid enthalpy geothermal systems, geo-hazard management, and upper-crustal geology • Experience with working in intercultural teams at leading institutes and companies across the world • Proven ability to successfully integrate multi-disciplinary data to resolve complex geologic problems and build practical models • Proficient with seismic interpretation, well analyses, and basin modelling workflows • Characterized as a dedicated and compassionate colleague with broad interests, who also knows his way around a kitchen.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 14806433, 'name': 'Veegeo Sproule Geothermal', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHAxZvydA-Skw/company-logo_400_400/0/1655109079627?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=bqmuO-LJJdtSzUvvJkAIyL9480wqnGSjUe2QZItlA1Q', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/veegeo/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Veegeo Sproule Geothermal', 'description': 'Veegeo Sproule Geothermal is Sproule’s geothermal arm, which specialises in geothermal production and reservoir engineering, project management, strategic advisory and due diligence, and geo-hazard management and geological evaluations. 

Throughout the year our team continuously supports 150+ MWth of geothermal heat capacity with production engineering and/or geo-hazard management. Besides, we manage wells delivery projects and provide strategic and technical advise during the development and realisation phases to national (up to date over 70% of the operating geothermal projects in the Netherlands) and international geothermal operators. 

My team supports our clients with: 
- Seismic risk management (SHRA, seismic monitoring, and seismic response protocols) 
- Subsidence monitoring 
- Subsurface geological analyses
- Geothermal advisory and due diligence  
- Research and development projects', 'title': 'Senior Geoscientist, Geothermal', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Veegeo Sproule Geothermal', 'description': None, 'title': 'Consultant Geothermal Energy', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 11361, 'name': 'The University of Tokyo', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGTfGPDRc1jGw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856580387?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=P_f9GDlL1vwpxY5g16Tl9T4d8AIqYGblscIimBqbm5I', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/university-of-tokyo/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Tokyo, Japan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'The University of Tokyo', 'description': 'Research at the Earthquake Prediction Research Center of the Earthquake Research Institute. 

As part of the Sea of Japan Tsunami Hazard Project, which is an extensive, multi-discipline, inter-institutional project funded by the Japanese Government, my main responsibility included:
• Locating and determining the geometry of potential tsunami source-faults in the southern Sea of Japan using extensive 2D seismic reflection data (with Petrel) for further hazard-assessment. 

Other responsibilities included:
• Supervision of M.Sc. students (M.Sc. and special projects): project design, guidance, and editing and reviewing theses and manuscripts. 
• Give technical talks at major international geoscience conferences (e.g., EGU, JpGU) and companies (e.g., Schlumberger).
• Write reports and collaborate within an international, multi-discipline project. 
• Proof-read and edit manuscripts for team-members. 

This project supported my post-doctoral research on the structural and stratigraphic development of the Tsushima Strait, southern Sea of Japan that comprises: 
• Evaluation and integration of sedimentological, palaeo-climate, palaeo-water depth data from wells, with structural, magmatic, and gravity data. 
• Investigating the implications on the large-scale tectonic development of inverted back-arc basins. 
• Field work: Cenozoic geology (sedimentation and tectonics) in NE Honshu and Kyushu, Japan.', 'title': 'Project research geoscientist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 28130220, 'name': 'Equinor', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEY5vHCfHo1DA/company-logo_400_400/0/1526452887848?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=tVqLHpBgrD7iPAOV1c6bjia2pBV-HfZglqbVlVUR2R4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/equinor/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'London, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Equinor', 'description': 'Equinor (formerly Statoil) is a major, world-leading energy company from Norway that funded my Ph.D. research. During my Ph.D. I spent several days a week working in the Equinor London office on proprietary 3D "mega-merge" seismic reflection data. 

My research focussed on the evolution of the East Shetland Basin, northern North Sea using Petrel.  
Methods included:
• Detailed seismic interpretation of 2D/3D seismic reflection data 
• Correlating stratigraphic analyses of extensive well data
• Synthetic seismic well-ties
• Seismic attribute generation', 'title': 'Post-graduate researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 5106, 'name': 'Imperial College London', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQFIhkSnjV0YNg/company-logo_400_400/0/1688215733626?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=MBkjrj7l16j4o04zoIKj2JeTCQ4MTUSDVDWRfUdnJZo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/imperial-college-london/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Imperial College London', 'description': 'Graduate Teaching Assistant for multiple M.Sc. and B.Sc. courses at the Department of Earth Science and Engineering. My role involved: 
• Supporting the lecturer during lectures. 
• Setting up and assisting students one-on-one with practicals.
• Grading coursework

M.Sc. Petroleum Geoscience courses: Seismic Interpretation, Basin Analyses, Witch Farm Project, Imperial Barrel Award, Field trips to Texas/New Mexico and Derbyshire

Undergraduate courses: Structural Geology 1, Structural Geology 3, Seismic Techniques, Basins and Tectonics, Dynamic Earth 2', 'title': 'Graduate teaching assistant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 28130220, 'name': 'Equinor', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEY5vHCfHo1DA/company-logo_400_400/0/1526452887848?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=tVqLHpBgrD7iPAOV1c6bjia2pBV-HfZglqbVlVUR2R4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/equinor/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bergen Area, Norway', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'Equinor', 'description': "Summer internship at Equinor's Research, Development & Innovation, and Exploration & Production departments. My research comprised seismic interpretation of high-resolution OBC data, focussing on structural evolution of Oseberg Main Area, northern North Sea using Petrel. 

My research included:
• Locating structural closures
• Building a 3D fault model
• Quantitative fault growth analyses
• Seismic facies analyses", 'title': 'Research intern', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 28130220, 'name': 'Equinor', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEY5vHCfHo1DA/company-logo_400_400/0/1526452887848?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=tVqLHpBgrD7iPAOV1c6bjia2pBV-HfZglqbVlVUR2R4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/equinor/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bergen Area, Norway', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Equinor', 'description': "Equinor also funded my M.Sc. degree at Colorado School of Mines as a Research Assistent. As part of my M.Sc. project I worked as a graduate student researcher at Equinor's Research, Development and Innovation department in the Autumn of 2009 and Spring of 2010. 

My research included:
• Building a 3D analogue geomodel of a salt-cored, carbonate dome using remote-sensing data, Petrel, 3DMove, ArcGIS, and GoCAD.
• Fracture analyses using photo-realistic LiDAR data using Statoil Digitizer.
• 3D Carbonate facies modelling using Petrel.", 'title': 'Graduate student researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}]
